definition[0]: used to say that something may be true, but you are not sure
example[2]: It won’t take so long next time, perhaps.
example[3]: ‘I don’t think you understand.’ ‘Well, perhaps not.’
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually use may or might rather than use perhaps it/she/they etc will:
definition[1]: used to give your opinion, when you do not want to be too definite
example[5]: This is perhaps her finest novel yet.
example[6]: The industrial revolution was, perhaps, the most important event in history.
definition[2]: used to say that a number is only a guess
example[7]: The room was large, perhaps 20 feet square.
definition[3]: used to politely ask or suggest something, or say what you are going to do
example[9]: I thought perhaps we’d have lunch in the garden.
